column5: as far as i know there aren't any detailed maps,yet.we'll be going to tall pines june 18 for a week.it will be our 3rd trip there.steve and andrea are longtime friends of theirs from their home in iowa.i am green with envy of their life style!we hope to hit better weather than last year without the 70 mph wind and super cold front.in the past we have had good walleye,smallmouth and ring perch fishing without working too hard at it.steve is pretty good about letting you know what's going on.

hi any help on fishing for smallmouth their would be appreciated. we will be there May 27-june 2 at peffreys. I believe peffrys web site has decent map. we blew it up and laminated it. My fishing buddy owns a Mail boxes etc (fringe benefits).We might be able to send you a copy. sidewinder
I've got a map of Wabby ... it'll cost you Canadian Beer. Meet you at Sleepy Dog on the 11th 8:30am bring variety of your fav Canadian beer!
here is a link to a great waba map...http://www.fishingmap.com/shop/paper...-lake-map.html we will be there June 3-10. Can't wait!
Tin Cann Shares no information so don't ask!!!!!!!!!

will be there then at tall pines, first time on this lake..going with wife and another couple give me a shout if you will be up there then will be in a green sylvin 17 ft. 50 hp tiller stop in for a beer wayne

Will be going to Wine lake that week. Maybe see ya on way in.They tell us that ice is out and water is low. Any info you get would be appreciated and will pass on any thing we hear. Maybe even have a blue or 2 on way in .

You will like Steve and Andrea, they are great people. We will be leaving June 3 from Tallpines Camp, and will leave some fish for you to catch. Ask Steve he 'll tell you where to go.

Anyone know what lake conditions are now on Wabby
I was just curious where you could get a good fishing map of wabaskang. Any news of how the water level is this spring?

[font color=green size=3][b]Last week I was told the water level hasn't risen much. Even though there was good snow cover to melt, not much rain has fallen this spring. Most camps will give you a map, or Dutchies Store handles them. Wish'in I was fish'in on Wabby
